intro: Lacinaria pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence, which is typical of the family. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Lacinaria pauciflora is adapted to dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
